required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate Dental Plaque Benefit of a Preventive Treatment Gel
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study to Evaluate Anti-Plaque Benefit of a Gel in a Modified- 4 Day Plaque Model

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to evaluate anti-plaque efficacy of a preventive treatment gel in a modified 4-day plaque model.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Turesky Modified Quigley-Hein Index at Day 4
primary_outcome.description: The Turesky Modified Quigley-Hein Index was scored on six surfaces (distobuccal, midbuccal, mesiobuccal, distolingual, midlingual and mesiolingual) to assess plaque on all gradable teeth. Whole mouth average plaque scores were calculated for each subject and tooth surfaces by totaling the scores and dividing by the number of gradable sites examined. the scoring criteria is below; (0) No Plaque; (1) Separate flecks of plaque at the cervical margin; (2) A thin, continuous band of plaque (up to 1 mm) at the cervical margin; (3) A band of plaque wider than 1 mm, but covering less than one third of the side of the crown of the tooth; (4) Plaque covering at least one third, but less than two thirds of the side of the crown of the tooth; (5) Plaque covering two thirds or more of the side of the crown of the tooth.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Turesky Modified Quigley-Hein Index at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The Turesky Modified Quigley-Hein Index was scored on six surfaces (distobuccal, midbuccal, mesiobuccal, distolingual, midlingual and mesiolingual) to assess plaque on all gradable teeth. Whole mouth average plaque scores were calculated for each subject and tooth surfaces by totaling the scores and dividing by the number of gradable sites examined. the scoring criteria is below; (0) No Plaque; (1) Separate flecks of plaque at the cervical margin; (2) A thin, continuous band of plaque (up to 1 mm) at the cervical margin; (3) A band of plaque wider than 1 mm, but covering less than one third of the side of the crown of the tooth; (4) Plaque covering at least one third, but less than two thirds of the side of the crown of the tooth; (5) Plaque covering two thirds or more of the side of the crown of the tooth.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Baseline Mean Digital Plaque Imaging

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: This was a single center, controlled, examiner-blind, randomized, 2-treatment, 3-period cross-over 4-day partial brushing plaque study. Each participant received Test product 1 (0.4% stannous fluoride preventive gel), and Test product 2 (marketed 0.243% sodium fluoride toothpaste). All subjects saw each test product at least 1 time, for the third period, each subject saw either Test product 1 or Test product 2 for a second time.

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: This was a controlled, examiner-blind, randomized, 2-treatment, 3-period cross-over 4-day partial brushing plaque study.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected for the entire duration of the study for each intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
